title: Ticket #4169: Speed up schedd restart time by eliminating uneeded fsyncs
description:
CMS AnaOps reported to htcondor-support:

  Dear HTCondor team. I just restarted the schedd on a node that was handling 7k running jobs. At start time, the schedd wasted ~3mins printing out the remaining job lease times! The CPU usage during that time was in the ~2% range. That's a lot of wasted time! I expect a non-negligible fraction of the job leases expired due to this :( Is the schedd at least doing anything useful in that time, or is it really just waiting on log file being written to disk?

Upon investigation, the problem was not so much the printing of remaining lease times into the SchedLog, but that the schedd does one fsync during recovery for every job that was running at the time of the crash in order to reconcile committed run times. The proposed patch will

  1. fsync just once after correcting committed run times for all jobs (instead of an fsync per job), and
  2. move the dprintf mentioned from D_ALWAYS to D_FULLDEBUG.
